title: Set uploaded image as landing page hero image

requirements.text: Ensure the landing-page hero image referenced by `frontend/src/components/AuthGate.tsx` at `/assets/generated/home-hero.dim_1600x600.jpg` exists as a static asset in the frontend build output and loads successfully in the deployed app.

quotes: Make this the Image on the Landing page

acceptanceCriteria: Requesting `/assets/generated/home-hero.dim_1600x600.jpg` in the deployed app returns HTTP 200 and renders an image (not a 404).
The landing page hero image displays without triggering the error fallback in normal conditions.

requirements.text: Update the hero image file content to use the newly uploaded image (`image-8.png`) while keeping the public URL path unchanged (`/assets/generated/home-hero.dim_1600x600.jpg`).

quotes: Make this the Image on the Landing page

acceptanceCriteria: The file `frontend/public/assets/generated/home-hero.dim_1600x600.jpg` is produced from `image-8.png` and is a 1600Ã—600 JPG.
No code changes are required to the `src` URL in `AuthGate.tsx` (it remains `/assets/generated/home-hero.dim_1600x600.jpg`).

requirements.text: Keep the existing landing-page hero image load-error fallback behavior in `frontend/src/components/AuthGate.tsx` so the page layout remains stable if the hero image fails to load.
acceptanceCriteria: If the hero image fails to load (e.g., missing asset), the placeholder block renders and maintains the same aspect ratio as the image container.

constraints: Do not change the hero image public URL path; it must remain `/assets/generated/home-hero.dim_1600x600.jpg` as referenced in `frontend/src/components/AuthGate.tsx`.
Do not modify files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or other frontend immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Changing landing page layout, copy, or CTA behavior beyond ensuring the hero image displays.

edits: Crop/resize to a wide hero and export as JPG (image-8.png > home-hero.dim_1600x600.jpg)
